SmallCover.label: SMALL COVER
SmallCover.description: If at least 25% of the target is covered the target recieves the following bonuses: An unmodified roll on the ATTACK of 1-5 will always be a critical miss and the target recieves +2 to DODGE and SHIELD BLOCK

MediumCover.label: MEDIUM COVER
MediumCover.description: If at least 50% of the target is covered the target recieves the following bonuses: An unmodified roll on the ATTACK of 1-10 will always be a critical miss and the target recieves +4 to DODGE and SHIELD BLOCK

LargeCover.label: LARGE COVER
LargeCover.description: If at least 75% of the target is covered the target recieves the following bonuses: An unmodified roll on the ATTACK of 1-15 will always be a critical miss and the target recieves +6 to DODGE and SHIELD BLOCK

Prone.label: PRONE
Prone.description: While PRONE the Cost of the Move Ability is doubled, any MELEE ATTACK against you has ADVANTAGE and any MELEE ATTACK made by you has DISADVANTAGE. Additionally you always recieve at least SMALL COVER against any RANGED ATTACK.

Flanked.label: FLANKED
Flanked.description: While a creature is FLANKING it recieves a +2 bonus to any MELEE ATTACK against the surrounded target.

PartialConcealment.label: PARTIAL CONCEALMENT
PartialConcealment.description: While partially concealed the Concealment DT is equal 8 + Stealth Ranks. If the creature benefiting from PARTIAL CONCEALMENT makes an ATTACK it recieves a +5 bonus to that ATTACK

FullConcealment.label: FULL CONCEALMENT
FullConcealment.description: While partially concealed the Concealment DT is equal 15 + Stealth Ranks. If the creature benefiting from FULL CONCEALMENT makes an ATTACK it recieves ADVANTAGE or a +5 bonus to that ATTACK

Stunned1.label: STUNNED I
Stunned1.description: The affected creature is dazed and can't function properly being unable to use any [REACTION] and has their max [AP] reduced by 1.
Stunned1.summary: Can't use any [REACTION], [AP] are reduced by 1.

Frightened1.label: FRIGHTENED I
Frightened1.description: The affected creature is shaken by an event or creature and has DISADVANTAGE on any SPELL TEST or MARTIAL TEST and can't move closer to the source of their fear.
Frightened1.summary: [DISADVANTAGE] on any [SPELL TEST] or [MARTIAL TEST] against the source of fear and can't move closer to it.

Burning1.label: BURNING I
Burning1.description: A burning creature recieves 1d6 fire damage at the start their turn.The burning creature or a creature within melee can end this effect early by using 2 AP and making a DT 10 AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST to douse the flames. On a success the effect ends.
Burning1.summary: Recieves 1d6 fire damage at the start of the turn, can douse the flames to stop the burning.

Bleeding1.label: BLEEDING I
Bleeding1.description: A bleeding creature recieves 1d6 damage at the start of their turn which can't be reduced in any way. The bleeding can be stopped early by using 2 AP and making a DT 10 CON Medicine ATTRIBUTE TEST. On a success the effect ends. Creatures without blood or similar like undeads, constructs, plants or extraplanar creatures are immune to this.
Bleeding1.summary: Recieves 1d6 damage at the start of turn, can be stopped.

Poison1.label: POISON I
Poison1.description: A poisoned creature recieves 1d6 poison damage at the start their turn. The affected creature can repeat the SAVE that caused the poison at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success. If no SAVE was made, then it must make a DT 10 TOUGHNESS SAVE
Poison1.summary: Recieves 1d6 poison damage at the start of the turn.

Charmed1.label: CHARMED I
Charmed1.description: A charmed creature regards the charmer as a trusted ally and as such won't harm it in any way. The charmer has ADVANTAGE on any D20 TEST to interact socially with the creature. If the charmed creature recieves damage they can repeat the SAVE caused them to be charmed, if there was no SAVE involved they must make a DT 10 WILLPOWER SAVE. If the charmer harms the charmed creature, they can repeat the SAVE with ADVANTAGE
Charmed1.summary: Regards the charmer as an ally and won't harm them.

Crippled1.label: CRIPPLED I
Crippled1.description: A crippled creatures base MP are now 2 unless they are already less. Each time a crippled creature uises the Dash ability, they only get 1 MP
Crippled1.summary: Base [MP] are set to 2, Dash only grants 1 [MP].

Cursed1.label: CURSED I
Cursed1.description: A lightly cursed creature recieves a 1d4 penalty to any ATTACK MARTIAL TEST or SPELL TEST it makes.

Weakened1.label: WEAKENED I
Weakened1.description: Each time a lightly weakened creature deals damage, it deals 1d6 damage less which can't be reduced below 1.
Weakened1.summary: Each time a creature deals damage it deals 1d6 damage less (min 1)

Vulnurable1.label: VULNURABLE I
Vulnurable1.description: A lightly vulnurable creature has their DODGE, STABILITY, TOUGHNESS and WILLPOWER are reduced by 2 or any SAVE Test made recieves a 1d4 penalty.
Vulnurable1.summary: All [SAVE] characteristics are reduced by 2 or -1d4 to any [SAVE] Test.

Restrained1.label: RESTRAINED I
Restrained1.description: A grappled creature can’t use it’s MP for anything other than making an escape attempt by spending 5 MP and making a DODGE SAVE or STABILITY SAVE (grappled creature's choice) against the grappler’s Grapple DT and escaping on a success. The creature has DISADVANTAGE on any ATTACK against Targets other than the grappler.
Restrained1.summary: Can't use [MP] other than escaping, [DISADVANTAGE] on any [ATTACK] that does not target the grappler.

Silenced.label: SILENCED
Silenced.description: A slienced creature can't talk or use any Spell Ability that has verbal components.
Silenced.summary: Can't talk, can't use a Spell Ability Ability with verbal components.

Deafened1.label: DEAFENED
Deafened1.description: A deafened creature can't hear or use any Spell Ability that has verbal components.
Deafened1.summary: Can't hear, can't use a Spell Ability with verbal components.

Intoxicated.label: INTOXICATED
Intoxicated.description: An Intoxicated creatures WILLPOWER, PER, AGI are reduced by 5, but it however recieves a +10 bonus to any SAVE made to resist the [FRIGHTENED I], [FRIGHTENED II] or [FRIGHTENED III] status effects.
Intoxicated.summary: [WILLPOWER], [PER] and [AGI] are reduced by 5, resistant to fear.

Distracted.label: DISTRACTED
Distracted.description: A distracted creature suffers a -2 penalty to any D20 TEST and has DISADVANTAGE on any PER ATTRIBUTE TEST and their passive Awareness and Investigation is halved.
Distracted.summary: -2 to any [D20 TEST]. [DISADVANTAGE] on [PER] [ATTRIBUTE TEST] and penalty to passive Awareness/Investigation

Stunned2.label: STUNNED II
Stunned2.description: The affected creature is heavily stunned and can bearly act. They can't use any REACTION, their MP and AP are reduced by 2.
Stunned2.summary: Can't use any [REACTION], [MP] and [AP] are reduced by 2.

Frightened2.label: FRIGHTENED II
Frightened2.description: The affected creature is frigthened by an event or creature and has DISADVANTAGE on any D20 TEST as long as they are within 18m of the source of your fear and can see or hear them. Additionally they can't move closer to the source of your fear.
Frightened2.summary: [DISADVANTAGE] on any [D20 TEST], can't move closer to source of fear.

Burning2.label: BURNING II
Burning2.description: A burning creature recieves 4d6 fire damage at the start their turn.The burning creature or a creature within melee can end this effect early by using 2 AP and making a DT 15 AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST to douse the flames. On a success the effect ends.
Burning2.summary: Recieves 4d6 fire damage at the start of the turn, can douse the flames to stop the burning

Bleeding2.label: BLEEDING II
Bleeding2.description: A bleeding creature recieves 4d6 damage at the start of their turn which can't be reduced in any way. The bleeding can be stopped early by using 2 AP and making a DT 15 CON Medicine ATTRIBUTE TEST. On a success the effect ends. Creatures without blood or similar like undeads, constructs, plants or extraplanar creatures are immune to this.
Bleeding2.summary: Recieves 4d6 damage at the start of turn, can be stopped.

Poison2.label: POISON II
Poison2.description: A poisoned creature recieves 4d6 poison damage at the start their turn. The affected creature can repeat the SAVE that caused the poison at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success. If no SAVE was made, then it must make a DT 15 TOUGHNESS SAVE
Poison2.summary: Recieves 4d6 poison damage at the start of the turn.

Charmed2.label: CHARMED II
Charmed2.description: When the charmer applies the condition, they give out a task towards the charmed creature. The charmed creature will carry out this task to the best of it's ability unless it is suicidal or goes strongly against their core values.
Charmed2.summary: The charmed creature carries out a task given by the charmer.

Crippled2.label: CRIPPLED II
Crippled2.description: The affected creature is heavily crippled and can't use any MP and is unable to properly defend itself with DODGE and STABILITY are 0 and it automatically fails any such SAVE

Cursed2.label: CURSED II
Cursed2.description: A cursed creature recieves a 1d8 penalty to any ATTACK MARTIAL TEST or SPELL TEST it makes.

Weakened2.label: WEAKENED II
Weakened2.description: Each time a weakened creature deals damage, it only deals halve as much (rounded down).
Weakened2.summary: Each time a creature deals damage it only deals halve damage.

Vulnurable2.label: VULNURABLE II
Vulnurable2.description: A vulnurable creature has their DODGE, STABILITY, TOUGHNESS and WILLPOWER are reduced by 4 or any SAVE Test made recieves a 1d8 penalty.
Vulnurable2.summary: All [SAVE] characteristics are reduced by 4 or -1d8 to any [SAVE] Test.

Restrained2.label: RESTRAINED II
Restrained2.description: A restreained creature can’t use it’s MP for anything other than making an escape attempt by spending 5 MP and making a DODGE SAVE or STABILITY SAVE (restrained creature's choice) against the grappler’s Grapple DT and escaping on a success. The creature has DISADVANTAGE for any ATTACK or AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST it makes and it's DODGE is reduced by 5. A restrained creature can’t make attacks with two-handed weapons unless they are wielded in only one hand, additionally it can’t use any Spell Ability that has somatic components.
Restrained2.summary: Can't use [MP] other than escape, [DISADVANTAGE] for any [ATTACK] and [AGI] [ATTRIBUTE TEST], [DODGE] reduced by 5. Can't use abilities or weapons requiring 2 hands.

Blinded.label: SILENCED
Blinded.description: A blinded creature fails any PER ATTRIBUTE TEST relying on sight and any enemy is under PARTIAL CONCEALMENT. If the blinded creature is additionally [DEAFENED] all enemies recieve FULL CONCEALMENT
Blinded.summary: Can't see, every enemy recieves [PARTIAL CONCEALMENT].

Taunted.label: DEAFENED
Taunted.description: A taunted creature can not use any harmful ability that targets a creature other than the Taunter and can't move further away from the Taunter.
Taunted.summary: Can only target the taunter with harmful abilities.

Decaying.label: DECAYING
Decaying.description: A decaying creature can't regain any HP but can still recieve THP

Stunned3.label: STUNNED III
Stunned3.description: The affected creature is paralyzed and unable to act anymore. They can't use any REACTION, MP or AP Additionally they are unable to properly defend themselves as such they can't use shields, their DODGE and STABILITY are 0 and they automatically fail any DODGE or STABILITY SAVE
Stunned3.summary: Can't use any [REACTION], [MP] or [AP]. [DODGE] and [STABILITY] are 0.

Frightened3.label: FRIGHTENED III
Frightened3.description: The affected creature is terrified by an event or creature and has to spend all MP to move away from the source of fear and all their AP to further flee until the source of fear is no longer within line of sight and at least 18m away from them.
Frightened3.summary: Deeply terrified, has to spend all [AP] and [MP] to fell from source of fear.

Burning3.label: BURNING III
Burning3.description: A burning creature recieves 10d6 fire damage at the start their turn.The burning creature or a creature within melee can end this effect early by using 2 AP and making a DT 20 AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST to douse the flames. On a success the effect ends.
Burning3.summary: Recieves 12d6 fire damage at the start of the turn, can douse the flames to stop the burning.

Bleeding3.label: BLEEDING III
Bleeding3.description: A bleeding creature recieves 12d6 damage at the start of their turn which can't be reduced in any way. The bleeding can be stopped early by using 2 AP and making a DT 20 CON Medicine ATTRIBUTE TEST. On a success the effect ends. Creatures without blood or similar like undeads, constructs, plants or extraplanar creatures are immune to this.
Bleeding3.summary: Recieves 12d6 damage at the start of turn, can be stopped.

Poison3.label: POISON III
Poison3.description: A poisoned creature recieves 12d6 poison damage at the start their turn. The affected creature can repeat the SAVE that caused the poison at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success. If no SAVE was made, then it must make a DT 20 TOUGHNESS SAVE
Poison3.summary: Recieves 12d6 poison damage at the start of the turn.

Charmed3.label: CHARMED III
Charmed3.description: The affected creature is completely mind-controlled and has to obay any commands issued by the charmer which requires no AP or REACTION from the charmer and can be done at any time. If the charmer orders a suicidal command or one that strongly goes against their strongest beliefs and principles they can repeat the SAVE that caused them to be charmed and on a success they don't have to obey that command, the charmer then can't repeat that same command again. If there was no SAVE involved, the charmed creature has to make a WILLPOWER SAVE with a DT determined by the GM.
Charmed3.summary: Is completely mind controlled by the charmer and can only perform Actions commanded by the charmer.

Cursed3.label: CURSED III
Cursed3.description: An [UNCONCIOUS] creature can't use any REACTION, MP or AP and is not aware of it's sourroundings as such they can't use shields, their DODGE and STABILITY are 0 and they automatically fail any DODGE or STABILITY SAVE A creature that is sleeping is also [UNCONCIOUS] however a Sleeping creature will wake up as soon as it receives damage or is distrubed in other ways.

Weakened3.label: WEAKENED III
Weakened3.description: A strongly cursed creature recieves a 1d12 penalty to any ATTACK MARTIAL TEST or SPELL TEST it makes.
Weakened3.summary: Each time a creature deals damage it only deals 10% damage.

Vulnurable3.label: VULNURABLE III
Vulnurable3.description: Each time the heavily weakened creature deals it deals just 10% (rounded down) of the original damage.
Vulnurable3.summary: All [SAVE] characteristics are reduced by 6 or -1d12 to any [SAVE] Test.

Unconcious.label: UNCONCIOUS
Unconcious.description: A strongly vulnurable creature has their DODGE, STABILITY, TOUGHNESS and WILLPOWER are reduced by 6 or any SAVE Test made recieves a 1d12 penalty.
Unconcious.summary: Can't use any [REACTION], [MP] or [AP], s unnaware of their sourroundings and unable to defend themselves.

Bless1.label: BLESS I
Bless1.description: A lightly blessed creature recieves a 1d4 bonus to any ATTACK MARTIAL TEST or SPELL TEST it makes.

Protection1.label: PROTECTION I
Protection1.description: A lightly protected creature has their DODGE, STABILITY, TOUGHNESS and WILLPOWER are increased by 2 or any SAVE Test made recieves a +1d4 bonus.
Protection1.summary: All [SAVE] characteristics are increased by 2 or +1d4 to any [SAVE] Test.

Haste1.label: HASTE I
Haste1.description: A quickened creature recieves a +2 bonus to their MP and each time they use the Dash ability thy gain an extra +2 MP. Additionally their DODGE is increased by 2 and they recieve ADVANTAGE for any AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST

MagicResistance1.label: MAGIC RESISTANCE I
MagicResistance1.description: A lighlty magic resistant creature recieves a +4 bonus to any SAVE made against a Spell Ability
MagicResistance1.summary: +4 bonus to any [SAVE] against a Spell Ability.

Healing1.label: HEALING I
Healing1.description: A lightly healing creature receives 1d6 HP at the start of their turn.
Healing1.summary: Heals 1d6 [HP] at the start of their turn.

Invisible1.label: INVISIBLE I
Invisible1.description: An occluded creature recieves PARTIAL CONCEALMENT bonus against any enemy and a +5 bonus to your Stealth.

Focused.label: FOCUSED
Focused.description: While you are focuesed you make any INT, PER ATTRIBUTE TEST or Tool SKILL TEST with ADVANTAGE
Focused.summary: Make any [INT], [PER] [ATTRIBUTE TEST] or Tool [SKILL TEST] with [ADVANTAGE].

Bless2.label: BLESS II
Bless2.description: A blessed creature recieves a 1d8 bonus to any ATTACK MARTIAL TEST or SPELL TEST it makes.

Protection2.label: PROTECTION II
Protection2.description: A protected creature has their DODGE, STABILITY, TOUGHNESS and WILLPOWER are increased by 4 or any SAVE Test made recieves a +1d8 bonus.
Protection2.summary: All [SAVE] characteristics are increased by 4 or +1d8 to any [SAVE].

Haste2.label: HASTE II
Haste2.description: A quickened creature recieves a +4 bonus to their MP, +1 extra AP at the start of their turn and each time they use the Dash ability thy gain an +4 MP. Additionally their DODGE is increased by 4 and they recieve ADVANTAGE for any AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST

MagicResistance2.label: MAGIC RESISTANCE II
MagicResistance2.description: A magic resistant creature recieves a +4 bonus to any SAVE made against a Spell Ability. Additionally any Spell Ability that deals damage now only deals half damage.
MagicResistance2.summary: +4 bonus to any [SAVE] against a [TAG;Spell] Ability, only recieve half damage from a [TAG;Spell] Ability.

Healing2.label: HEALING II
Healing2.description: A healing creature receives 4d6 HP at the start of their turn.
Healing2.summary: Heals 4d6 [HP] at the start of their turn.

Invisible2.label: INVISIBLE II
Invisible2.description: An invisible creature recieves FULL CONCEALMENT bonus against any enemy and a +10 bonus to your Stealth.

Bless3.label: BLESS III
Bless3.description: A strongly blessed creature recieves a 1d12 bonus to any ATTACK MARTIAL TEST or SPELL TEST it makes.

Protection3.label: PROTECTION III
Protection3.description: A strongly protected creature has their DODGE, STABILITY, TOUGHNESS and WILLPOWER are increased by 6 or any SAVE Test made recieves a +1d12 bonus.
Protection3.summary: All [SAVE] characteristics are increased by 6 or +1d12 to any [SAVE] Test.

Haste3.label: HASTE III
Haste3.description: A quickened creature recieves a +8 bonus to their MP, +2 extra AP at the start of their turn and each time they use the Dash ability thy gain an +8 MP. Additionally their DODGE is increased by 8 and they recieve ADVANTAGE for any AGI ATTRIBUTE TEST

MagicResistance3.label: MAGIC RESISTANCE III
MagicResistance3.description: Any Spell Ability can't affect this creature directly. However indirect effects such as a rock being magically accelerated against the creature or a pit being created unter the creature still affect it.

Healing3.label: HEALING III
Healing3.description: A strongly healing creature receives 12d6 HP at the start of their turn.
Healing3.summary: Heals 12d6 [HP] at the start of their turn.
